org.dcm4che3.conf.dicom

Class CommonDicomConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dcm4che3.conf.dicom.CommonDicomConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, DicomConfiguration, DicomConfigurationManager, ExtendedDicomConfiguration, TransferCapabilityConfigExtension, ConfigurationManager
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommonDicomConfigurationWithHL7

    public class CommonDicomConfiguration
extends Object
implements DicomConfigurationManager, TransferCapabilityConfigExtension

    This class is part of the Maven module dcm4che-conf-dicom.

      • preventDeviceModifications

        public void preventDeviceModifications(Device d)
        Description copied from interface: DicomConfigurationManager
        Remembers a weak reference to the provided device so that any subsequent call to persist or merge for this specific instance is made, an error is logged. This is a safeguard against misusing a singleton injected device and making direct modifications on it. In future, logging an error will be replaced with throwing an exception
        Specified by:
        preventDeviceModifications in interface DicomConfigurationManager

      • sync

        public void sync()
          throws ConfigurationException
        Description copied from interface: DicomConfiguration
        Invalidates any present cached state for the configuration storage view of the client. There is no guarantee whether the devices accessed afterwards will be re-loaded lazily or eagerly. Has no effect for non-cached or consistently-cached configuration storage backends.
        Specified by:
        sync in interface DicomConfiguration
        Throws:

      • runBatch

        public void runBatch(DicomConfiguration.DicomConfigBatch dicomConfigBatch)
        Description copied from interface: DicomConfiguration
        Provides support for batching configuration changes.

        It is guaranteed that
        • All configuration reads and writes in a batch are performed within a single transaction, i.e. the changes are atomic and performed in READ COMMITTED isolation
        • When this method is called, an ongoing transaction (in case there is one) will be SUSPENDED. The batch will ALWAYS be executed in a SEPARATE transaction.
        • At most ONE batch is executed at the same time in the whole cluster (synchronized with a database lock)
        Specified by:
        runBatch in interface DicomConfiguration
        Parameters:
        dicomConfigBatch - Configuration batch to execute
